meta.evidence:
If the SRS is configured by the [E SRS-PosResource, the quantity k_{\text {offset }}^{l^{\prime}} is given by Table 6.4.1.4.3-2, otherwise k_{\text {offset }}^{l^{\prime}}=0 . The frequency domain shift value n_{\text {shift }} adjusts the SRS allocation with respect to the reference point grid and is contained in the higher-layer parameter freqDomainShift in the SRS-Resource [E or the SRS-PosResource [E. The transmission comb offset \bar{k}_{\mathrm{TC}} \in\left\{0,1, \ldots, K_{\mathrm{TC}}-1\right\} is contained in the higher-layer parameter transmission C o m b in the SRS-Resource [E or the SRS-PosResource [E and n_{b} is a frequency position index. Frequency hopping of the sounding reference signal is configured by the parameter b_{\text {hop }} \in\{0,1,2,3\} , given by the field b -hop contained in the higher-layer parameter freqHopping if configured, otherwise b_{\text {hop }}=0 .
---
- Defining partial frequency sounding factor and start RB index for partial frequency sounding as defined by the higher layer parameters FreqScalingFactor \mathrm{P}_{\mathrm{F}} and StartRBIndex k_{\mathrm{F}} , respectively, and described in Clause 6.4.1.4 of [4, TS 38.211]. If not configured, then P_{F}=1 and k_{F}=0 . - Defining start RB index hopping for partial frequency sounding in different SRS frequency hopping periods for aperiodic/periodic/semi-persistent SRS based on the hopping pattern k_{\text {hopping }} as described in clause 6.4.1.4.3 in [4, TS 38.211. If not configured, then start RB hopping is not enabled and k_{\text {hoppng }} is fixed to be 0 for all SRS symbols. - Defining frequency domain position and configurable shift, as defined by the higher layer parameters freqDomainPosition and freqDomainShift, respectively, and described in clause 6.4.1.4 of [4, TS 38.211]. If freqDomainPosition is not configured, freqDomainPosition is zero. - Cyclic shift, as defined by the higher layer parameter cyclicShift-n2, cyclicShift-n4, or cyclicShift-n8 for transmission comb value 2, 4 or 8, and described in clause 6.4.1.4 of [4, TS 38.211]. - Transmission comb value, as defined by the higher layer parameter transmission Comb described in clause 6.4.1.4 of [4, TS 38.211]. - Transmission comb offset, as defined by the higher layer parameter combOffset-n2, combOffset-n4, and combOffset-n8 for transmission comb value 2, 4, or 8, and described in clause 6.4.1.4 of [4, TS 38.211].
